meanings.definition: Moving back and forth in a straight line.
meanings.sent1: The reciprocating motion of the swing was soothing.
meanings.sent2: The reciprocating fan kept the room cool.
meanings.sent3: The reciprocating boat rocked gently on the calm lake.
meanings.sent4: Her reciprocating footsteps echoed in the empty hallway.
meanings.sent5: The reciprocating pendulum swung steadily in the clock.

meanings.sent1: They enjoy reciprocating gifts during the holidays.
meanings.sent2: Friends often reciprocate favors to help each other.
meanings.sent3: The siblings reciprocated hugs after a long separation.
meanings.sent4: She reciprocated the smile of the friendly cashier.
meanings.sent5: The team reciprocated the opponent's good sportsmanship.

meanings.sent1: The mechanic repaired the reciprocating engine in the old car.
meanings.sent2: The train was powered by a reciprocating engine.
meanings.sent3: The inventor proudly displayed his new reciprocating engine design.
meanings.sent4: The factory upgraded to a more efficient reciprocating engine.
meanings.sent5: The museum showcased a historic reciprocating engine model.
